description: Two storey rear/side wrap around extension (Joint application)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s): P103 A - Proposed Block Plan, P202 A - Proposed Plans and Elevations, P301 A - Proposed Ground Floor Plan, P302 A - Proposed First Floor Plan, P303 A - Proposed Roof Plan, P401 A - Proposed Front and Rear Elevations, P402 A - Proposed Side Elevations - 35 Malden Avenue and P403 A - Proposed Side Elevations - 33 Malden Avenue
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2025).
| The development hereby permitted shall be commenced and completed in its entirety and simultaneously.

Reason: In the interests of visual appearance and to ensure the living conditions of the occupiers of each property is protected, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2025), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021)

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 & D6 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing's local Plan (Reg.22), Ealing's Housing Design Guidance 2022 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2025). | The proposed windows on the side elevations (to no.35 Malden Avenue facing rear gardens of properties at Wadham Gardens) shall contain only obscure glass and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with NPPF 2025 - section 12, policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg,22).

| The development hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.22) and the National Planning Policy Framework 2025.
